meanings.definition: The act of attending church services.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy the churchings on Sundays with my family.
meanings.sent2: Many people find comfort in their weekly churchings.
meanings.sent3: After the churchings, we always have a nice meal together.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt lighter after the churchings, like a burden had been lifted.
meanings.sent5: The churchings filled the air with songs of peace and hope.

meanings.definition: The practice of going to church regularly.
meanings.sent1: His churchings are a part of his routine every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: She believes in the power of consistent churchings.
meanings.sent3: Even on vacation, he never misses his churchings.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to churchings is unwavering, like a rock in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The churchings bring a sense of community and belonging.

meanings.definition: The ceremony of blessing a woman after childbirth.
meanings.sent1: The churchings for the new mother were filled with love and support.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, churchings are an important tradition after giving birth.
meanings.sent3: The churchings ceremony was a beautiful celebration of new life.
meanings.sent4: The churchings symbolized a fresh start, like a blooming flower.
meanings.sent5: The churchings brought peace and healing to the new mother.
